_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Linde Gas North America, LLC facility located in Hammond, Indiana complies with NFPA requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency accidental release were to occur involving our propane or acetylene storage/handling systems, it is our policy to immediately notify the Hammond Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency.  In addition, each employee is trained monthly on safety policies and procedures.  Employees also participate in Quarterly Safety Committee meetings for the facility.  Hazards identified during the meetings are corrected accordingly.

2.  A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:
The Linde Gas facility manufactures and stores acetylene.  Acetylene is put into storage cylinders of various s before they are sold and shipped from the facility.  The acetylene manufacturing/handling/storage process consists of chemical acetylene trailers, a medium pressure acetylene generator, and a high pressure cylinder filling area.  

Acetylene is compressed using chemical acetylene stored on trailers that have acetylene cylinders manifolded together.  The trailers contain approximately 5,785 lbs of acetylene each and are connected to a common manifold.  The piping from the manifold runs underground to the northwest corner of the plant, and then runs above ground to the generator and compressor room.  The supply lines are equipped with pull away protection, flow reducing pressure regulators, 1.2 orifice plates, large flash arrestor, and check valves to protect against reverse flow.

The acetylene generator uses calcium carbide to generate acetylene gas that is purified and piped to the high pressure cylinder fill area where it is compressed and routed through manifolds that are used to fill multiple cylinders.  

3.  The general accidental release prev

ention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
The Linde Gas facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state and local codes and regulations.  The propane and acetylene systems are designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA and state law at the Linde Gas facility in Hammond, Indiana.  All leaks are immediately reported to supervision.  Prompt clean-up of accidental releases and investigation into root causes are conducted to make corrections and to prevent future occurances.

4.  Five-year accident history:
The Linde facility in Hammond, Indiana has not had any reportable accidents in the last five years. 

5.  The emergency response program:
In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our propane or acetylene storage system, it is Linde Gas' policy to immediately notify the Hammond Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency.  We have communicated this policy with the Hammond Fire Department.  All employees have access to Linde Gas' emergency action plan and emergency action training is conducted annually.  Linde Gas also has an Emergency Response Team within one hour of the facility who responds to emergencies.  The responders carry a Technical level certification and are trained as required by OSHA 1910.120.  An ADT alarm system is installed in critical areas and a fire drill is performed each year with all employees.

6.  Planned changes to improve safety:  
Periodic tours and training are available for firefighting staff which serve to better our relationship and involvement with Hammond Fire Department.
